DoingBusinessAsName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA LICENSING & VENTURES GROUP

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE PRINCIPAL ACTIVITY OF THE FOUNDATION IS TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION TO "ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE AND SERVE THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA, THE NATION, AND THE WORLD THROUGH... INNOVATION" VIA COMMERCIALIZATION OF UNIVERSITY RESEARCH AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. THIS ACTIVITY INCLUDES SUPPORTING THE UNIVERSITY'S INDUSTRY AND TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH INITIATIVES; PERFORMING DUE-DILIGENCE ON SOLICITED AND DISCLOSED INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY; PREPARING AND FILING PATENT APPLICATIONS, COPYRIGHTS, AND TRADEMARKS; ENGAGING IN BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT; NEGOTIATING AND EXECUTING LICENSE AGREEMENTS; SUPPORTING NEW VENTURE CREATION; INVESTING IN UVA PORTFOLIO COMPANIES; MONITORING COMPLIANCE; AND DISTRIBUTING INCOME.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF UVA'S INNOVATION ASSETS VIA COMMERCIALIZATION, WHILE PROVIDING HIGH LEVELS OF CUSTOMER SERVICE, VALUE-ADDED BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT, NEW VENTURE CREATION, AND A FOCUS ON DRIVING QUALITY TRANSACTIONS.
IRS990.Desc: PATENTING: THE PATENTING TEAM PREPARES AND FILES PATENT APPLICATIONS. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED 2018, THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA PATENT FOUNDATION D/B/A UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA LICENSING AND VENTURES GROUP (LVG OR THE FOUNDATION) PREPARED AND FILED 98 U.S. PROVISIONAL PATENT APPLICATIONS AND WAS ISSUED 162 PATENTS, 59 OF WHICH WERE U.S. PATENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: LICENSING: THE LICENSING TEAM EVALUATES, MARKETS, AND LICENSES INVENTIONS. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED 2018, LVG SOLICITED 213 INVENTION DISCLSOURES FORM UVA FACULTY, STAFF, AND STUDENT INVENTORS AND EXECUTED 77 COMMERCIAL TRANSACTIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: NEW VENTURES: LVG PROVIDES RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE TO SUPPORT THE ENTREPRENEURIAL AND INVESTMENT PROCESS. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED 2018, LVG HELPED LAUNCH 3 NEW VENTURES. ADDITIONALLY, LVG MANAGES AN INNOVATION FUND, WHICH IS COMPRISED OF SEED FUNDING AND VENTURE FUNDING, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA AND THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH SYSTEM.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES: LVG PROVIDES A VARIETY OF OTHER PROGRAMS, GENERALLY AT THE REQUEST OF UVA. FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED 2018, OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDED THE MENINGEAL DRUG DISCOVERY PROGRAM AND BIOSCIENCES EDUCATION.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: MANAGING DIRECTOR, SEED FUND AND NEW VENTURES

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART VI, SECTION E, LINE 1C
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE PRINCIPAL ACTIVITY OF THE FOUNDATION IS TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION TO "ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE AND SERVE THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA, THE NATION, AND THE WORLD THROUGH... INNOVATION" VIA COMMERCIALIZATION OF UNIVERSITY RESEARCH AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. THIS ACTIVITY INCLUDES SUPPORTING THE UNIVERSITY'S INDUSTRY AND TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH INITIATIVES; PERFORMING DUE-DILIGENCE ON SOLICITED AND DISCLOSED INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY; PREPARING AND FILING PATENT APPLICATIONS, COPYRIGHTS, AND TRADEMARKS; ENGAGING IN BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT; NEGOTIATING AND EXECUTING LICENSE AGREEMENTS; SUPPORTING NEW VENTURE CREATION; INVESTING IN UVA PORTFOLIO COMPANIES; MONITORING COMPLIANCE; AND DISTRIBUTING INCOME. IF THESE ACTIVITIES WERE NOT PERFORMED BY THE FOUNDATION, THEY WOULD BE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY. ALL EXPENSES INCURRED FOR EXECUTING THESE ACTIVITIES ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE UNIVERSITY, AND CONSEQUENTLY, FOR THEIR SUPPORT.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: INVESTMENTS HELD FOR UVA LVG SEED FUND

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: INVESTMENTS HELD FOR UVA LVG SEED FUND

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS REVIEWED AND EVALUATED THE RELEVANT TECHNICAL MERITS OF EACH OF ITS TAX POSITIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDANCE ESTABLISHED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD AND DETERMINED THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE FOUNDATION.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: THE FOUNDATION IS A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. THE AMOUNT OF CASH PAID TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR DISTRIBUTIONS OF ROYALITIES TO THE INNOVATION & SCHOLARLY ACTIVITIES FUND AND TO THE UNIVERSITY BASED ON THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE FOUNDATION AND THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. THE PAYMENT DOES NOT INCLUDE ANY REFUND FOR OVERPAYMENT OF FEES FOR SERVICES RENDERED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AMOUNT OF SUPPORT PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA IS DETERMINED BY THE FOUNDATION'S TOTAL PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES. THE FOUNDATION IS FUNCTIONALLY INTEGRATED AND ALL PROGRAM EXPENSES INCURRED ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA, AND CONSEQUENTLY, FOR THEIR SUPPORT.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: MANAGING DIRECTOR, SEED FUND AND NEW

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LVG'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATES THAT EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SUBMIT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY IS DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD. KEY EMPLOYEE'S SALARIES ARE DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORMS 1023 AND 990 ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR SELECTION AND RETENTION OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEARS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VII AND SCHEDULE J PART II
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CERTAIN DIRECTORS ARE FULL TIME EMPLOYEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA, THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION. COMPENSATION PAID BY THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA FOR THESE DIRECTORS IS REPORTED ON FORM 990 PART VII AND SCHEDULE J PART II.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII AND SCHEDULE J, PART II
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FIVE OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. NUMEROUS OTHER BOARD MEMBERS ARE AFFILIATED WITH THE UNIVERSITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART I, LINE 11G, COLUMN V
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AMOUNT OF SUPPORT PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA IS DETERMINED BY THE FOUNDATION'S TOTAL PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES. THE FOUNDATION IS FUNCTIONALLY INTEGRATED AND ALL PROGRAM EXPENSES INCURRED ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA, AND CONSEQUENTLY, FOR THEIR SUPPORT.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: PROMOTE & AID SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATION & RESEARCH AT UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
